intro: Utricularia longissima, commonly known as the long-stemmed bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, bladder-like structures used to trap prey. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as marshes and ponds. Its flowers are usually small and greenish-white, arranged in clusters. Utricularia longissima is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor water conditions.
